rComments: Fitnat is great! Extremely knowledgeable and has a cute  fun class persona. She was tough, but tells you exactly how much you need to know for her exams. Definitely prepare to put in work in her class, but its honestly a class you can take a lot out of. I feel like I learned more in this class than any other Biology class in Santa Cruz.

Very passionate about the material. Go to her office hours and ask questions, because she will answer in the clearest manner possible and make you feel at ease. Also come to lectures & sections for extra notes and be sure to study her in-class and study questions. She will make you think about the material through her exams, not just memorizing.

Fitnat is a great professor! She encourages students to ask questions during class, and she is very helpful during office hours. How to pass: Go to class, study the notes (she includes study questions at the end of every lecture. Know the answer to all of those questions), go to discussion section and office hours, and do not fall behind.

Study the lecture slides.  These are key to an A.  Grading is pretty easy.  Most people think this class is hard, but it isn't...  Instead of testing rote memorization, Fitnat tests your critical thinking and data analysis skills on exams.  Also, class is awesome because no homework or quizzes.  Just three exams + 1 extra credit optional hw.
Way too detailed and expects you to know way too much... roughly 450 slides for midterm and so much material on a slide... don't take this if you can't put in 15 hours a week
She is nice enough. Test questions are too specific though.

Great lectures, very approachable, knows her stuff well.  A LOT of memorization is required, but that's like most biology courses.  Show up to class because there are things discussed in class that aren't in the online lecture slides.
Ick. Take another instructor if at all possible.  Very arrogant and teaches everything off of slides which have huge chunks of text just lifted off the text book.

She is a nice professor, but teaches at an okay level. She lectures from the lecture notes completely. Memorize/know/understand everything from the lecture notes, even the general and detailed information, because she will grade brutally on your tests. Her extra credit does not help at all.

She expects you to know everything. Goes through slides quickly (lectures are ~20 pages each, 4 slides/page). Has an accent that is sometimes hard to understand. Go to class though, she provides info not on lecture slides. Final is cumulative and you need to memorize all the slides. Provides extra credit, but don't assume it would help you a lot.

Horrible lecturer, will confuse the heck out of you, also very condescending. Skims through lectures too quickly to even write down notes, exams are all based on random info from the slides. Very picky grader, exam have a lot of confusing, AVOID

If you take this class be prepared to memorize every single slide. She emphasizes topics which wont be on tests and there is no study guides. It's hard to know what will be on the test. There are study questions but they didn't help. TAs even seemed frustrated. I hear Vicki Stone is a great teacher.

Horrible teacher. No practice test and extremely hard grader. Wants you to know every little detail down to which number sigma factor binds to where. You do not learn except stupid details that do not help you in the future, take with different professor!
The best teacher. i loved taking her class, very interesting and willing to help with questions. AND SHES PRETTY HOTT!!!!!!

boring, other than the pathogen lectures. first MD was solely on generic lecture notes (pic slides which are posted), MD 2 had stuff that was reminiscent on the class discussion during lecture and Final was a mix. shes ok, but she expects youto have a grand interest. usually not a big # of ppl take this class at a time,dont completely bomb one MD

Class is really fun.  The exam questions seem straight forward and you walk out of the test feeling like you did fine, but discover that you've been owned.  She is pretty particular about how she wants answers.  Be interactive in lecture, it's helpful.

Amazing Professor, she actually makes you think, something a lot of instructors don't do. Course was difficult for a Microbiology class, but was interesting. She does interactive learning and presents the material clearly.

Approachable and willing to help students but has a very thick accent. Grades consist of two HWs, two midterms, one final, and section attendance/participation.  Exams were difficult because she wanted detailed information and graders were really picky about particular answers and there's no curve. But I still enjoyed her class and learned a lot!

2 HW assigmts, 2 midterms. Picky grader. Lectures are printable online. Heavy accent. Doesn't give out old exams. Lots of extra reading besides the lecture notes....like knowing certain details about an organism. No review sessions, except TA discussion, but they're not making up the exam so it's unclear what to study for. HARD!!
very picky about grading in homework & on exams. covers wayyyyyyy too much info in a 10 week period. no curve!!!! accent is thick, thank goodness for printable lecture notes.
way too picky on grading. easy material but insane grading. take another class if possible, this one will drive you crazy.

First time teaching microbio and is very picky about everything, from homework response to test answers.  Goes over TOO MUCH MATERIALS in 10 weeks.  Grade consists of homework, discussion section, two midterms, and a final.  Go to office hours if you can...willing to help you.  Doesn't curve.
Goes over lost of material too fast. Is extremely picky on exams and homework. Doesn't curve.
Downloadable powerpoint lectures. Talks really fast. Very nitpicky about homework and test answers. Arrogant. Very smart though.
